caption:
This image captures a moment of agricultural activity, specifically within a cattle handling facility. A man appears engaged in a task involving a Hereford cow, which is partly seen through a chute designed for holding cattle during medical treatment or tagging. The man is focused on adjusting a part of the chute mechanism; he is dressed in a practical outdoor outfit, including a denim jacket and a beanie hat, suitable for farm work.

The environment around them is predominantly a dirt ground, typical of a livestock pen, surrounded by metal fencing. Behind the focal activity, you can observe other cattle in a pen, hinting at this being a part of a larger farming operation. The clear, bright sky suggests the photograph was taken on a sunny day, contributing to the stark shadows visible on the ground, which add a graphic element to the composition.

Overall, the photograph illustrates a typical day in cattle farming, highlighting the equipment and environment, as well as the direct interaction between the farmer and livestock.
title: Cattle raised on an experimental farm operated by epa's Las Vegas national research center
